intro: Mitriostigma monocaule, commonly known as the single-stemmed mitriostigma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, red berries. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
